conclusion: Determine the number of molecules in the gas using given data and ideal gas law.
Convert temperature at state A to Kelvin: \( T_A = -73^\circ \text{C} = 200 \, \text{K} \).
A to B is isothermal expansion; B to C is isochoric process.
Internal energy change from A to C is \( \Delta U = 200 \, \text{J} \).
Internal energy depends on temperature: \( \Delta U = nC_V\Delta T \).
Calculate temperature at C using \( \frac{p_B}{T_B} = \frac{p_C}{T_C} \) and solve for \( T_C \).
Calculate number of moles using \( \Delta U = nC_V\Delta T \).
Calculate number of molecules using Avogadro's number: \( N = n \times N_A \).
Final answer: The number of molecules of the gas is approximately \( 7.2 \times 10^{22} \).
